intro: Veronica maideniana, commonly known as the New Zealand veronica, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Veronica maideniana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and along stream banks.
